Transcription for 31731

I will dance and I will dance and I will dance at the moon tide.
I will dance and I will dance and I will dance again.
I will dance at the full moon tide. Here is no place a man can hide until sun shifts in,
burnishing to gold. I will dance right on as the dance unfolds, as the dance unfolds.
I will dance into this bright land, take the sea path across the strand. To the storm dark night
I will reach the shore, joining with the one who has gone before, who has gone before.
This is the song of Caridwen, Caridwen's song.
I will dance and I will dance and I will dance again.
I will dance and I will dance again.
